entry.title: iwa: Use jitter for update discovery timer
entry.content:
Similar to Chrome Extension updates, we add 20% jitter to the update

discovery timer for IWA updates, so that it becomes less likely for

severs to be overloaded if a lot of people start Chrome(OS) at the

same time.



To achieve this, we replace the `base::RepeatingTimer` with a

`base::CancelableCallback` that we regularly schedule with 20% jitter.



This also fixes a small bug where the install manager observation was

only started when automatic updates were enabled - however, now that

updates can also be triggered manually from chrome://web-app-internals

and potentially other sources, we need to make sure that

`OnWebAppUninstalled` is actually called.



Fixed: b:305004160

entry.title: crosier: Helper start/stop session_manager daemon
entry.content:
Add start/stop session_manager support to helper:

- Server runs session_manager daemon on a separate thread and

watch to its state. Once session_manager daemon terminates

(by itself or killed), sends back the state in the original

socket requested its start;

- Client provides API to start and stop the session_manager

daemon and a callback to be invoked when the daemon stops;

entry.title: [User Education] Allow Refresh What's New to show in latest milestone
entry.content:
Rollout for Chrome Refresh has been extended to M120. In this version,

there is also a dedicated milestone-based WNP, so both pages need to be

coexist. This is different than how the WN Refresh Page was originally

designed.



The entire basis for showing the refresh page hinges on the value of the

pref `hasShownRefresh2023WhatsNew`, but this lookup previously needed to

occur multiple times through the lifecycle of showing WN. This fix moves

the state of a the milestone-vs-refresh lookup into a query parameter

for the startup url.



Fixed: 1488584

entry.title: Stop assuming @chromium.org for flag-metadata.json owners
entry.content:
An owner without @ and without /OWNERS is currently interpreted as a

@chromium.org email. However, contributors with @google.com emails are

mistakenly omitting the domain, causing them to not get nags about

expired flags. See crrev.com/c/4953374 for one such case. Most new

Google contributors use @google.com emails and are prone to this mistake.



This CL:

- Drops support for such syntax in EnsureOwnersLookValid(). Trying to

use it will cause a failure of AboutFlagsTest.OwnersLookValid.

- Updates flag-metadata.json to use @chromium.org where appropriate

with a script, so the test passes.

- Updates the documentation on top of flag-metadata.json.



Fixed: 1493956

Change-Id: I259cd62705a0bd74351c7631285d966dd7952dfd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4952502

entry.title: background tracing: Use actual rule_id() to install named trigger rules
entry.content:
Reworked to remove flakiness of crrev.com/c/4931234 credit eseckler@.



With crrev.com/c/4685186, agents now are told about the rule's

rule_id(), rather than the histogram names (which correspond to

GetDefaultRuleId()).



This means that triggers sent by agents for any histogram rule with a

configured custom rule_id no longer match the named triggers installed

in BackgroundTracingManager.



Fixed by using the correct rule_id when installing the trigger in

BackgroundTracingManager.

entry.title: Reset ProfileTokenQuality observations in PDM::UpdateProfile()
entry.content:
Whenever the value for a token changes, the corresponding observations

need to be reset. This CL implements this behavior by modifying the

logic in the PersonalDataManager.



For incomging changes through sync, this logic doesn't need to be

applied - since all changes through sync are triggered by the PDM on

another client.



See the following doc for details:

entry.title: Member: Use implicitly converting peeker type in hash traits
entry.content:
Similar to scoped_refptr, rely on a peeker type that implicitly

converts from Member to T*. This is needed to remove Member's implicit

operator T* and maintain the ability to use methods that work with T*

and Member in colletions.

entry.title: [ios] Move LastInteractionTimeForGoodVisitsFollowing in PrefService
entry.content:
This CL moves LastInteractionTimeForGoodVisitsFollowing out of

NSUserDefaults.



The key has been moved in the PrefService. Note that there are two

types of PrefServices, in this case the code was moved in the

PrefService coming from BrowserState which is per account and is

syncable between devices.

Note that this kind of PrefService behaves differently from

NSUserDefaults which is per device (and not per account).

entry.title: Make AWGLSurface return true for IsOffscreen.
entry.content:
This surface is neither offscreen nor onscreen. Mostly used

as an unowned context to make all tracking on Chrome side happy given

display compositor doesn't really care whete to draw.



This change is required to make GLContext hold the default offscreen

surface. SharedContextState is going to be created only with offscreen

surfaces.

entry.title: Store additional FragmentData entries in a vector.
entry.content:
This turns NGPhysicalFragment::GetFragmentData() from O(n) into O(1),

which improves both pre-paint and paint when there are many columns /

pages involved.



The new multicol-many-columns.html performance test:

RunPrePaintLifecyclePhase(): 273ms -> 6.48ms

RunPaintLifecyclePhase(): 1065ms -> 5.76ms



Improvements can also be seen in the tall-content-short-columns.html in

perf_tests/layout/multicol/. It goes from 3.9 runs per second to 26 runs

per second.



Storing the vector in LayoutObject would be the most straight-

forward solution, but in order to not increase memory usage for

every LayoutObject in the world, keep storing a simple FragmentData

pointer in LayoutObject, and add additional entries to the new

vector in FragmentData::RareData. Only the first fragment will

populate this vector. There are DCHECKs for this.



Subclass FragmentData as FragmentDataHead to provide container class

functionality.



During pre-paint, when locating existing or creating new

FragmentData entries, avoid unconditionally looping through the

FragmentData entries and comparing fragmentainer indices (that was

one of the O(n^2) causes). For block fragments we can just use the

index of the physical fragment as the fragment data index. For

non-atomic inlines, it's a bit more complex, though, especially if

the inline formatting context is non-contiguous - but that should be

pretty rare. The old code had bugs here, which are now fixed. Some

of the new tests, but not all, used to fail.



Bug: 1478119

Change-Id: I9aad842d221e2ab2329fe818e0b45148bb4ddfa1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4946655

entry.title: Remove web_tests/printing/page-format-data.html
entry.content:
And, with that, we can remove isPageBoxVisible() and

pageSizeAndMarginsInPixels() from the test internals object.



This was all added in crrev.com/84ca7e95e440efd746e30d0b8a68354e0d9ad069



Not sure what the idea about isPageBoxVisible() was. Setting

visibility:hidden in the @page context doesn't really make the entire

page invisible (only what's in the page / page margin context). Add a

test for @page { visibility:hidden; } for the future. Note that

currently no browser supports painting anything there.



There are already many page size and margins tests in wpt/css/printing/,

which in many ways cover what pageSizeAndMarginsInPixels() used to test.

However, there were no tests for pre-defined page sizes (such as A4 or

Letter), so add that.

entry.title: Simplify FragmentData handling in PaintInfo.
entry.content:
Don't store a fragment ID anymore. Most of the time, when we have the

relevant NGPhysicalBoxFragment handy, we can easily get to the right

FragmentData from there. The only case where this isn't possible is when

using legacy painters. We still use those in a few cases (replaced

content, etc.). Legacy painters only support monolithic content, but the

object may still produce multiple fragments, if the object is repeated

over multiple fragmentainers, due to repeated table header footers, or

fixed-positioned elements when printing. In such cases, store the

FragmentData in PaintInfo when we leave the NG world and enter the

legacy world.



No behavior changes intended.



Change-Id: Icf0a286a03767322742f18ff0519813f6fe21496

entry.title: [ios] Add API to insert unrealized WebState in a session
entry.content:
As it is not possible to get the state from an unrealized WebState

when the optimised session storage is used (since it is likely not

loaded from the disk yet), SessionRestorationService needs an API

to prepare it to accept a new unrealized WebState.



Expose an API that takes a web::proto::WebStateStorage (that can

be created from web::NavigationManager::WebLoadParams using the

function web::CreateWebStateStorage(...)), create the WebState and

serialize the data to the disk.



Bug: 1383087

entry.title: Deprecate vector<v8::Local>, part 4
entry.content:
According to V8's public API documentation, local handles (i.e.,

objects of type v8::Local) "should never be allocated on the heap".

This disallows heap-allocated data structures containing instances of

v8::Local, like std::vector>. It is unfortunate

that the V8 API itself requires the usage of such data structures.



This CL continues the deprecation of such data structures. It replaces

such vectors with v8::LocalVector, recently introduced in V8 API,

which behave exactly the same with the exception that the V8 isolate

must be passed upon construction.



Most of the changes in this CL are trivial and are related to

third_party/blink/renderer.



Bug: chromium:1454114

Change-Id: Ia462aa5814b517697d1b38565c47029ea869d54f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4922316

Reviewed-by: Michael Lippautz

Reviewed-by: Yuki Shiino

Commit-Queue: Nikolaos Papaspyrou

Reviewed-by: Omer Katz

Reviewed-by: Kentaro Hara

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1212085}

entry.title: Clean up painting of fragmented relpos inline.
entry.content:
Only process the current block container fragment when painting a

LayoutInline that establishes a PaintLayer. We used to walk though all

the container fragments searching for the fragment items that belonged

to the current block container fragment. But that's not necessary if we

just figure out which container fragment is the current one. We used to

calculate the container fragment index using PaintController::

CurrentFragment(), which was a pretty dubious approach, although it

worked.



With the test included, this change reduces the time spent in

LocalFrameView::RunPaintLifecyclePhase() by about 50%. That doesn't make

a lot of overall difference, though, because PrePaint takes more than 50

*times* longer than actual painting, due to how NGInlineCursor works

with fragmented content; NGInlineCursor::MoveTo(const LayoutObject&) is

O(n), where n is the number of fragmentainers. Doing this for every

fragmentainer means O(n^2).



No behavior changes intended.



Change-Id: I5d377cbd5e64b4f978f6e83c2075dcc0b4aea6ab

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4946473

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Reviewed-by: Xianzhu Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1212084}

entry.title: Move ML output mapping to handler
entry.content:
This CL is like crrev.com/c/4946692, but for the ModelOutput instead

of ModelInput.



Currently, the ML model's output is mapped to ServerFieldTypes using a

hardcoded mapping. The goal is to get rid of this mapping and retrieving

it from the server using metadata. For this reason, this CL moves the

mapping from the executor to the handler.



The executor's model output is changed to vector>,

corresponding to the confidences for every type supported by the model,

for every field given to the model.



Bug: 1465926

entry.title: iwa: Fix update apply waiter signalling if no windows are open
entry.content:
If no windows of the app are open, then we need to make sure to signal

synchronously, so that the update apply task is immediately added to the

task queue before an update discovery task has a chance to start. Our

tests were supposed to verify this behavior, by checking that the start

times of the update discovery and apply tasks were in the expected

order. However, the use of mock time made `base::TimeTicks::Now()`

return the same value for all of the tasks, thus fulfilling the

`is_sorted` requirement. Therefore, this CL also refactors the tests to

rely less on mock time.



Bug: 1444407

Change-Id: I8c7bc33b6f16906f46ccb382b0fabca8debf2420

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4931836

Commit-Queue: Christian Flach

Reviewed-by: Robbie McElrath

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1212069}

entry.title: Move ML tokenization to handler
entry.content:
The AutofillModelExecutor is responsible for converting the

AutofillModelExecutor::ModelInput to TFLite's tensor representation and

back. Currently, the ModelInput type is a FormData, and the executor

performs two steps:

- Vectorizing the label of every field.

- Mapping the vectorized representation into the tensors.



Vectorization uses a dictionary, which is currently provided via a Finch

feature parameter. Eventually, this dictionary should be provided from

the server-side, as metadata to the model.



Since communicating with the server-side is the model handler's job,

the dictionary won't be available to the executor at this point.

This CL prepares the code for this future by changing the ModelInput to

the a std::vector. The tokenization logic is moved

to the handler.



As a result, the executor only becomes a thin layer above TFLite, which

handles the low-level conversion from one internal representation to

the other.



---



Technical note:

Initializing the vectorizer/loading the dictionary

is currently done lazily right before executing the model in

AutofillModelExecutor::Preprocess(). It was placed there, since reading

a file needs to happen on a background thread - and Preprocess() (like

all other operations on the executor) are called on a background

thread by the handler.



Initializing the vectorizer on a background thread in the handler is

more tricky, since its operations are generally on the UI thread. To

circumvent that, a task is posted to the thread pool, which

asynchronously creates the vectorizer.



This is ugly, but fortunately only a temporary solution. Once model

metadata is used to retrieve the dictionary, no file needs to be read

anymore and the vectorizer can be initialized synchronously.



Bug: 1465926

Change-Id: I709a6c61324910b3a96f6ab85d00fa0c8f101b10

syncable between devices.

NSUserDefaults which is per device (and not per account).

entry.title: Revert "URL: Measure escaped ASCII chars in URL path"
entry.content:
This reverts commit d919c8c6ca59705b67f852c2efc7d44611b4fb00.



Reason for revert: crbug.com/1252531 is fixed. Recording the

histogram takes time on a common path: GURL::GURL().



Original change's description:

> URL: Measure escaped ASCII chars in URL path

>

> Chrome currently unescapes percent-encoded ASCII characters in URL

> path. However, this behavior is non-compliant with the URL Standard.

>

> To address this interoperability issue, we need to assess the impact

> of fixing it.

>

> I worried about measuring being a hotspot since this can happen when

> constructing a GURL or KURL. However, we added a similar UMA for URL

> host part [1] in the past. So most likely this will be OK.

>

> [1] https://crrev.com/c/3152695

>

>

properly. Check if the user session is active in support_tool_util.cc

where we create the ChromeUserLogsDataCollector instance and also verify

that user is logged in inside the data collector before starting to

collect data.

entry.title: [sync] DualReadingListModel: Return const ptrs to underlying models
entry.content:
Right now, DualReadingListModel::Get*Model() methods return non-const

pointers to the underlying models. DualReadingListModel is not designed

in a way to handle direct updates to the underlying models so exposing

the methods as-is is kinda risky.



This CL updates the getters and since there's no usage mutitating the

returned values yet, does not need to fix them.

entry.title: Fix crash when closing privacy sandbox prompts.
entry.content:
When a privacy sandbox prompt is closed, PrivacySandboxServiceImpl::

MaybeCloseOpenPrompts also tries to close any prompts open in other

browsers. Opening a prompt would register its Widget* with the service

and closing it would deregister it. If a prompt was closed through

abnormal means, such as closing the window it was associated with, the

deregistration would not happen and the Widget pointer would leak,

causing a use-after-free later.



To fix this, this patch changes the deregistration to happen in

Widget::WindowClosing instead of DialogDelegate::WindowWillClose, and

so now it should always be run.



Bug: 1487986

Change-Id: Ief28cbf182cfe37b92a032be3cb1ca3c0ade9a08

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4952702

entry.title: [Android][SA] Add favicon to prompt
entry.content:
This CL adds the requesting origin favicon to the storage access prompt

in android.



Since the permission prompt for android lives in /components we first

need to get ahold of a FaviconService from the embedder so we can fetch

the favicon.



We have decided to leave the fetching of the favicon to the native

permission dialog delegate since that's where all the logic of fetching

the correct attributes for the dialog lives.



The favicon needs to be the same size as the icons which in Android:

24dp. The translation of dp to pixel needs to be done on Android since

that's where we have the correct context to translate dimensions to

pixels.



Screenshot with favicon: http://screen/5GfFgHbULbtGPUF



Fixed: b:304274489

Bug: 1478113

entry.title: Deprecate vector<v8::Local>, parts 1 and 2
entry.content:
According to V8's public API documentation, local handles (i.e.,

objects of type v8::Local) "should never be allocated on the heap".

This disallows heap-allocated data structures containing instances of

v8::Local, like std::vector>. It is unfortunate

that the V8 API itself requires the usage of such data structures.



This CL starts the deprecation of such data structures. It replaces

such vectors with v8::LocalVector, recently introduced in V8 API,

which behave exactly the same with the exception that the V8 isolate

must be passed upon construction.



Most of the changes in this CL are trivial and are related to renderer

extensions and accessibility features.



Among the non-trivial changes of this CL:



1. It adds the new vector type to the gin::Converter and renderer

V8 platform bindings conversion.

2. It specializes the gin::internal::ArgumentHolder template for

accepting such vectors.



Bug: chromium:1454114

Change-Id: I63a521785dc2df9100cf9ad2b40cd1b36b7c5d00

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4905474

entry.title: PopupCellView refactoring: remove cell's permanently highlighted state.
entry.content:
This state was used for the expandable control only. The control,

according to the refactoring plans, becomes a part of the row class.

It never gets highlighted on its own (only with the content cell,

i.e. as the whole row).

That is why the previous permanently highlighted state was moved to

the row class as more explicit "expandable" state.

The CL doesn't change any functionality.



Bug: 1491373

entry.content:

same place as for the other AWC APIs.



It also changes what happens if window-management permission is not

provided and for better user-XP doesn't kill the renderer but instead

logs a message to the developer console. Same happens if trying to use

the APIs outside of web apps.

entry.title: Add build flag for options.disclaim_responsibility in chromedriver
entry.content:
In chromedriver the options.disclaim_responsibility is set to true when

launching chrome binary to make Google's CI server happy, however for

some vender builds like Microsoft Teams they need to turn this off in

their test automation. We should make this option a build flag to make

both sides happy.



(In many CI enviroments, when the tested binary needs to request a macOS

permission suching as accessing camera/microphone, they usually grant

Terminal.app the necessary permissions so the built binaries can inherit

the permissions automatially. With options.disclaim_responsibility set

to true, macOS will ask permissions for the generated binary every time,

which essentially hangs the test automation.)



Bug: 1223643

Change-Id: Iee080c86816c8480351f884b3a2c4fc9ebf3e5d2

entry.title: [ios][web] Add helper to create a WebStateStorage
entry.content:
The embedder may want to be able to create unrealized WebState with

a specific navigation history (e.g. to implement features to create

a local tab from a remote tab).



Add an helper method to create a WebStateStorage from WebLoadParams.

The returned object can be used to create an unrealized WebState that

will navigation to the URL specified in the WebLoadParams object when

it becomes realized.

entry.title: Encoded Frame Size Estimator component
entry.content:
The encoded frame size estimate is based on QP values of current and

previous frames and stats of previously encoded frame data. The frame

size estimator uses a weighted moving average filter to keep the

statistics.

entry.title: [Element Capture][restrictTo] Share UMA enum type with Region Capture
entry.content:
Change the UMA enum type used by Region Capture to a more generic

type that can be shared with Element Capture, thereby allowing

much of the code to be shared, avoiding the cumbersome translations

and extensive boilerplate that would be needed to support different

types.



Note that this CL anticipates later changes. The new UMA that

uses the shared enum type is introduced in the later CL which

introduces restrictTo().

entry.title: Let InvalidationHandler receive only one invalidation at a time
entry.content:
All InvalidationHandler instances are looking at the latest

invalidation per topic only in OnIncomingInvalidation. Handlers either

handle



- incoming invalidations asynchronously (Drive)

- one topic only



This CL centralizes the logic of selecting the latest invalidation per

topic in invalidator_registrar_with_memory.cc. In case of a handler

being interested in multiple topics, OnIncomingInvalidation might be

called multiple times in direct succession.



This reduces complexity in the handlers and opens up opportunities to

simplify caching and processing of incoming invalidations in

components/invalidation.



Low-Coverage-Reason: TRIVIAL_CHANGE in affiliated_invalidation_service_provider_impl.cc



Bug: b/305203290

entry.title: [Shortcut] Support web app and shortcut replacing each other.
entry.content:
This CL supports web app and shortcut replacing each other with the new

shortcut UI. Web app system allow user to install a web app when there

is already a shortcut with the same start url, and vice versa. When

this happened, we need to remove the item from the other registry in

app service. In addition to that, the removal needs to happen before

the publishing of the new item, so that the launcher and shelf has

time to clean up the old item, and would not cause a crash.



BUG=b/304660864

entry.title: Revert "ash: make ScrollBarByDraggedDesk less flaky"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5c9b864629ad23180f5368eaf65366b35f523215.



Reason for revert:



On Linux Chromium OS ASan LSan Tests (1), tests are flaky

after this change.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Chromium%20OS%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20(1)/54147/overview



Original change's description:

> ash: make ScrollBarByDraggedDesk less flaky

>

> This CL addresses flakiness in the above test. The test verifies

> scrolling behavior in the desk bar by dragging a desk over the bar's

> scroll buttons. The scroll buttons have a built-in one second timer, and

> the test tries to time things according to this. This makes the test

> quite flaky.

>

> I've made a few changes to the test, and one to the code under test:

>

> * ScrollArrowButton has been changed so that it pays attention to

> ScopedAnimationDurationScaleMode instead of being locked to 1s.

> This means we can reduce our waits in the test.

>

> * The test no longer tries to verify intermediate steps of scrolling.

> It waits long enough for the desk bar to scroll completely to the end

> or beginning.

>

> * The test was previously saving a copy of `desks_bar->mini_views()`

> and indexing into it. This makes things harder to understand since

> the desk bar will reorder mini views in the desk bar. The test is

> now just getting the current state of the mini views whenever it

> needs to.

>

> * The test DesksTest.ContinueScrollBar has also been updated. The

> changes to ScrollArrowButton made the old logic no longer work. The

> test was doing the same attempt at precise waiting to catch

> intermediate scroll states, so those parts were removed as well.

>

> This is a re-land (with modifications) of https://crrev.com/c/4909698

>

> BUG=b:300012605

>

> Change-Id: I58b9572044f3057b9fa7c88b598acb64cd356d53

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4917795

> Commit-Queue: Daniel Andersson

> Reviewed-by: Yongshun Liu

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1211759}



BUG=b:300012605
